result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Bernard Gooden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is set at zero.
Pay the DNA surcharge plus costs, surcharges and disbursements. Should defendant get revoked and be sent to prison, Court ordered monies taken by the Department of Corrections from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance would then be paid while on extended supervision.   Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

Seek and maintain employment.
Be given job and vocational training.
Obtain G.E.D.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.

No Contact with Co-Actors: Pekory Terrell, Tramaine Reed, Ashley or Brittany.
No controlled substances or alcohol.

Participate in a parenting program.
Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Provide DNA sample.
Court advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

AODA assessment and treatment.
Urine screens.

timeConds.notes: With release to the Day Reporting Center to include parenting classes and work. Good time allowed.  The report date is stayed until May 27, 2015 by 5:00 pm.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darryl Bernard Gooden

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Incarceration Credit form, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Darryl Bernard Gooden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report received and filed.
Bail motion to modify GPS by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court orders GPS modified to allow for release for job search and school.

Defendant Darryl Bernard Gooden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense received additional discovery and requests another scheduling date.  Court orders case adjourend to Branch 20.  Defense requests to address bail.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Darryl Bernard Gooden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requested another scheduling date.  Justice Point reports filed, including one fpr violation (violated inclusion zone).  Court admonished the defendant and ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed.  Also filed:  Violation report.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Hollis M., Dominoes Pizza, Co Actors: Pekory Terrell and Tramaine Reed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. 
Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  
Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Defendant Darryl Bernard Gooden in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  
Defendant Darryl Bernard Gooden in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
